An open city where innovations, arts and crafts, traditions, and humor are born.
Armenia’s cultural soul and creative spirit in one walkable city.

data.name: AboutUsLong
data.value: This website is your guide to experiencing Gyumri fully and authentically—whether you’re here for a weekend, a month, or making the city your new home. It brings together everything you need to explore Armenia’s cultural capital, from iconic landmarks and historic neighborhoods to offbeat adventures, cozy cafés, and local favorites.

data.name: AboutUsShort
data.value: Your guide to experiencing Armenia's cultural capital

data.name: Find1
data.value: Real recommendations on where to eat, sleep, and relax—based on what's truly popular, not paid placements.

data.name: Find2
data.value: Practical info to help you navigate life in Gyumri—transport, services, housing, remote work, and more.

data.name: Find3
data.value: Curated listings of events, seasonal experiences, and neighborhood highlights.

data.name: Find4
data.value: Tools to help you plan your trip, submit an event, or even ask locals your questions (upcoming).

data.name: Find5
data.value: And soon: a local coupon system offering discounts and perks at featured cafés, shops, and guesthouses around the city.

data.name: MainArticleDesc
data.value: Tucked in the northwestern corner of Armenia, Gyumri is a city that surprises you—not with skyscrapers or glitter, but with soul. It doesn't shout for attention. It whispers stories through its streets, scents, and sunsets. Here's why your next trip should bring you to this one-of-a-kind city.

data.name: Platform
data.value: This platform was created as part of the "Open Data Project for Accurate Visitor Information in Gyumri," a sub-project within the "Mayors for Economic Growth" grant program. The program is funded by the European Union and implemented by UNDP, with this project brought to life by the Gyumri Technology Center (GTC) and Vanadzor Technology Center (VTC) by the Enterprise Incubator Foundation (EIF).

data.name: Point2Desc1
data.value: Gyumri has always been Armenia's cultural capital—but lately, something new is stirring. The city's rich heritage in theater, music, and visual arts is fusing with a younger generation's bold experimentation. Painters, potters, coders, animators, filmmakers, and fashion designers are redefining what it means to be "creative" in Gyumri.

data.name: Point2Desc2
data.value: The streets hum with creative energy: mural art on old facades, digital artists working out of tech hubs, handmade jewelry on display in boutique shops. Institutions like the Gyumri Technology Center and TUMO support a growing wave of innovation, blending tradition with tomorrow.

data.name: Point2Desc3
data.value: And it's not just about the art—it's about the atmosphere. You feel it in conversations at gallery openings. You hear it in the fusion of old folk melodies and electronic beats drifting from rehearsal rooms. You see it in workshops where Soviet tools are repurposed to make something entirely new.

data.name: Point3Desc1
data.value: In Gyumri, your feet are your best travel guide. The city was made for walking—not just because the layout is compact and scenic, but because the real magic happens when you take your time.

data.name: Point3Desc2
data.value: Stroll along Rustaveli Street and pop into an antique shop. Cut through a courtyard and find yourself in front of an impromptu nardi game. Sit on a public bench, and a local might start telling you about the earthquake, the artists, or the best ponchik in town.

data.name: Point3Desc3
data.value: There's no need for taxis, timetables, or noise-canceling headphones. The silence is soft, the air is fresh, and the streets reward the curious. You won't just get from point A to point B—you'll get a hundred little stories in between.

data.name: Point4Desc1
data.value: Let's be honest—travel can get expensive. But in Gyumri, your money stretches without cutting corners on experience. You can enjoy a full homemade lunch, coffee, and dessert for the price of a metro ticket in most major cities. Boutique guesthouses offer character and comfort at a fraction of what you'd pay elsewhere.

data.name: Point4Desc2
data.value: Whether you're touring local museums, enjoying live music, or hopping into a marshrutka for a scenic countryside ride, you don't need to budget your joy. Even high-value experiences—like attending a puppet show, taking a pottery class, or spending an afternoon in a traditional bathhouse—are refreshingly affordable.

data.name: Point4Desc3
data.value: Gyumri proves that adventure doesn't have to be expensive. It just has to be real.

data.name: Point5Desc1
data.value: Every city has a flavor, and Gyumri's is unforgettable. The day might begin with a breakfast of fresh cheese, herbs, and warm lavash from a corner bakery. By midday, you're hunting down the famous "Ponchik Monchik"—a hot, cream-filled doughnut so good it has its own legend.

data.name: Point5Desc2
data.value: Lunch could bring you to a family-run fish restaurant, where trout from local rivers is served grilled and smoky, alongside roasted potatoes and pickled vegetables. You might sip homemade oghi (fruit vodka) with your host, or taste jams made from wild rose petals and walnuts.

data.name: Point5Desc3
data.value: And dinner? Maybe a cozy bistro in a renovated brick building, offering modern takes on traditional dishes—like lamb stew with herbs, or beetroot salads with garlic and walnuts. Every bite tells a story of land, season, and hospitality.

data.name: Point5Desc4
data.value: In Gyumri, food isn't just sustenance. It's poetry.

data.name: PointDesc1
data.value: In Gyumri, every step is a step through time. The moment you enter the historic Kumayri district, you're surrounded by 19th-century buildings carved from the city's signature black tuff stone. Their thick walls and ornate wooden balconies have stood through earthquakes and empires, and they still hold the rhythm of old conversations and distant music.

data.name: PointDesc2
data.value: Keep walking and you'll find splashes of color in unexpected places—Soviet-era mosaics tucked between courtyards, ironwork gates that creak with age, and fading shop signs in retro Cyrillic script. It's a rare kind of city where history hasn't just been preserved—it's lived in. Cafés operate out of century-old homes, and artisan workshops are nestled in what used to be merchant houses.

data.name: PointDesc3
data.value: In Gyumri, architecture isn't a background. It's a co-narrator.

data.name: Tool
data.value: This isn't just a website—it's a tool to make Gyumri more visible, accessible, and welcoming, for visitors and locals alike.

data.name: WhyReason
data.value: Because it's not trying to be like anywhere else. It's not racing to keep up with trends. It's walking to its own rhythm—inviting you to slow down, look closer, and stay longer.

data.value: We only collect the information you choose to share with us, such as:

data.value: Choose not to provide personal data by avoiding forms and interactive tools

data.name: PrivacyDesc1
data.value: Your privacy matters to us. This website is committed to protecting your personal information and being transparent about how we collect, use, and store data. Below is a summary of what you need to know.

data.name: PrivacyHowDesc
data.value: Your data is stored securely on servers managed by our technology partner. We use industry-standard security measures to protect it from unauthorized access, modification, or disclosure.

data.name: PrivacyMatters
data.value: Your privacy matters to us. We're committed to protecting your personal information.

data.name: PrivacySell
data.value: We never sell your data to third parties. Ever.

data.name: PrivacyToolsDesc
data.value: We may use services like Google Analytics, social media integrations (e.g. Instagram embeds), or email marketing tools to better understand usage and reach. These platforms have their own privacy policies, which we recommend reviewing.

data.name: PUpdatesDesc
data.value: We may update this privacy policy if new features or services are added. Any changes will be reflected on this page with an updated date.

data.name: PWhy1
data.value: Provide accurate responses to your questions
